messages.message: RBS question: can we specify runtime arguments when running a flow binary via API? I don’t see anything in the documentation about it but feel like folks have mentioned this ability @dlluncor @shaunak @Heymian
Yep! I’ve done it before. If you inspect the http request when running a flow binary, I think that’s the best way to see all the features you can use
It’s params.runtime_configs iirc. Can confirm in a bit when I get back into office
However, you *cant* pass runtime configs for just a flow run as far as I can tell. Has to be a binary
@Chetan let me know if you can view that doc, cc: @Kerry

i’m confused by the last statement @Erick — so runtime flow args can only be put in for flow binary execute API not the flow execute API?

@Justin yea i can — looks like we can just add arbitrary things inside settings{} in the headers? How do we read this info from within a UDF?
Not the header the body :slightly_smiling_face: . To read it from a UDF pass it in as a parameter. I think I have an example flow somewhere
